lexUnit.name: bicker.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: argue about petty and trivial matters.

sentence.text: I will not have you two bickering . "
` So that explains why you 're always so tense when I 'm around and why we always seem to end up bickering ? "
" I 'm not standing here all day bickering about this .
New Zealand 's previous Labour government found itself unable to complete the job of economic liberalisation , and its members bickered among themselves .
Those who had fought together for the overthrow of Charles I , now bickered amongst themselves .
Charman bickered with Allison , often over irrelevant points .
He did n't want to end up a mean and ignorant man like his father , or spend the years bickering I N I with brother Shamus .
You look as if you 've been bickering with a volcano . "
Sir : The residents of this once tranquil village have been bickering for years about the best way to deal with increasing traffic .
` My God , ca n't you two stop bickering for once ?
The political parties warmed up for a general election by bickering over whether the new health trusts remain part of the national health service .
The government and the ANC are bickering over the preconditions for negotiation -- matters such as the bringing home of exiles and the release of political prisoners .
It had become a political hot potato , and time ran out as backers bickered over what tests to run .
The wily president had showed himself capable of taking action while others were just bickering .
However , no one had pushed him and there was no point in bickering over trifles .
They shared a doughnut and bickered over which half was smallest .
Since she got here , everyone 's been bickering .
Children were bickering , mothers scolded .
Come , we are grown and we talk like children bickering over gleanings . "
Alfred was nowhere to be seen , Emily and Heinrich were bickering over the mayonnaise , and James Pegg and Alice were silently working together on a salad .
We 'd been bickering since New Year and she 'd flounced out of my city flat in early May , darkly muttering , Nevermore !
